name: 4-{(2E)-3-[4-(dimethylamino)phenyl]prop-2-enoyl}phenyl 2-methoxybenzoate
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1123
Reason: 4-{(2E)-3-[4-(dimethylamino)phenyl]prop-2-enoyl}phenyl has a melting point that we will compare to benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The basic unit for comparison can be the phenyl group, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The introduction of the methoxy group (–OCH3) in place of a hydrogen atom increases the molecular weight and size which generally raises the melting point. The dimethylamino group (N(C)C) adds rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C. The prop-2-enoyl group introduces a carbonyl-like functional group, which can participate in dipole interactions and rigidify the structure, estimated at around +20°C. The phenyl group also introduces additional pi-stacking interactions, estimated at around +20°C. The dioxane-like bridging moiety adds rigidity and likely contribute more significantly than a simple ether, estimated at around +5 °C for this structural feature.
